Package goGame

Class Board

  • java.lang.Object
    • goGame.Board
  • public class Board
extends java.lang.Object
    Model of board for the GO game.
    Author:
    Huub Lievestro

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      class  Board.Coordinate2D
      2D coordinates, representing a (row,col) on the board.

        public Board​(int dimension)
      throws InvalidFieldException
        Creates an empty board.
        Throws:
        InvalidFieldException
        Ensures
        all intersections are UNOCCUPIED

    • Method Detail

      • getDim

        public int getDim()
        Get the dimension of the board.
        Returns:
        DIM dimension of the board

      • deepCopy

        public Board deepCopy()
        Creates a deep copy of this board.
        Ensures
        the result is a new object, so not this object, the values of all intersections of the copy match the ones of this Board

      • indexLinear

        public int indexLinear​(int row,
                       int col)
        Calculates the index in the linear array of intersections from a (row, col) pair.
        Returns:
        the index belonging to the (row,col)-intersection, or -1 if 2D is outside board TODO use exception?
        Requires
        row to be between 0 and DIM, col to be between 0 and DIM

      • index

        public Board.Coordinate2D index​(int i)
        Calculates the 2D coordinate in the 2D matrix of intersections from a linear index pair.
        Returns:
        the corresponding (row,col) index, or null if outside board TODO use exception?
        Requires
        linear index to be between 0 and DIM*DIM

      • index

        public Board.Coordinate2D index​(int row,
                                int col)
        Calculates the 2D coordinate in the 2D matrix of intersections from a row,col pair.
        Returns:
        the corresponding (row,col) index
        Requires
        row to be between 0 and DIM, col to be between 0 and DIM

      • isField

        public boolean isField​(int index)
        Check if linear index is valid (on board). Returns true if index is a valid index of a intersection on the board.
        Returns:
        true if 0 <= index < DIM*DIM
        Ensures
        a positive result when the index is between 0 and DIM*DIM

      • isField

        public boolean isField​(int row,
                       int col)
        Returns true if the (row,col) pair refers to a valid intersection on the board.
        Returns:
        true if 0 <= row < DIM && 0 <= col < DIM
        Ensures
        true when both row and col are within the board's bounds

      • isField

        public boolean isField​(Board.Coordinate2D coordinate)
        Returns true of the 2D coordinate refers to a valid intersection on the board.
        Returns:
        true if 0 <= row < DIM && 0 <= col < DIM
        Ensures
        true when both row and col are within the board's bounds

      • getField

        public Stone getField​(int i)
        Returns the content of the intersection i.
        Parameters:
        i - the index of the intersection
        Returns:
        the Stone on the intersection
        Requires
        i to be a valid intersection
        Ensures
        the result to be either BLACK, WHITE or UNOCCUPIED

      • getField

        public Stone getField​(int row,
                      int col)
        Returns the content of the intersection referred to by the (row,col) pair.
        Parameters:
        row - the row of the intersection
        col - the column of the intersection
        Returns:
        the stone on the intersection
        Requires
        (row, col) to be a valid intersection
        Ensures
        the result to be either BLACK, WHITE or UNOCCUPIED

      • getField

        public Stone getField​(Board.Coordinate2D coordinate)
        Returns the content of the intersection referred to by the 2D coordinate.
        Parameters:
        coordinate - of the intersection
        Returns:
        the stone on the intersection
        Requires
        2D coordinate to be a valid intersection
        Ensures
        the result to be either BLACK, WHITE or UNOCCUPIED

      • isEmptyField

        public boolean isEmptyField​(int i)
        Returns true if the intersection i is empty.
        Parameters:
        i - the index of the intersection
        Returns:
        true if the intersection is empty
        Requires
        i to be a valid intersection index
        Ensures
        true when the Stone at index i is UNOCCUPIED

      • isEmptyField

        public boolean isEmptyField​(int row,
                            int col)
        Returns true if the intersection referred to by the (row,col) pair it empty.
        Parameters:
        row - the row of the intersection
        col - the column of the intersection
        Returns:
        true if the intersection is empty
        Requires
        (row, col) to be a valid intersection
        Ensures
        true when the Stone at (row, col) is UNOCCUPIED

      • isEmptyField

        public boolean isEmptyField​(Board.Coordinate2D coordinate)
        Returns true if the intersection referred to by the 2D coordinate it empty.
        Parameters:
        coordinate - of the intersection
        Returns:
        true if the intersection is empty
        Requires
        2D coordinate to be a valid intersection
        Ensures
        true when the Stone at 2D coordinate is UNOCCUPIED

      • newBoardFromString

        public static Board newBoardFromString​(java.lang.String boardString)
        Creates a new Board object from a String representation of the board. NOTE: creates a new board (will not be connected to the game)
        Parameters:
        boardString - to parse
        Returns:
        newBoard from String

      • reset

        public void reset()
           throws InvalidFieldException
        Empties all intersections of this board (i.e., let them refer to the value Stone.UNOCCUPIED).
        Throws:
        InvalidFieldException
        Ensures
        all intersections are UNOCCUPIED

      • setField

        public void setField​(int i,
                     Stone color)
              throws InvalidFieldException
        Sets the content of intersection i to the stone s.
        Parameters:
        i - the intersection index
        color - of the stone to be placed
        Throws:
        InvalidFieldException
        Requires
        i to be a valid intersection
        Ensures
        intersection i to be set to Stone s

      • setField

        public void setField​(int row,
                     int col,
                     Stone color)
              throws InvalidFieldException
        Sets the content of the intersection represented by the (row,col) pair to the stone s.
        Parameters:
        row - the intersection's row
        col - the intersection's column
        color - of the stone to be placed
        Throws:
        InvalidFieldException
        Requires
        (row, col) to be a valid intersection
        Ensures
        intersection (row, col) to be set to Stone s

      • setField

        public char setField​(Board.Coordinate2D coordinate,
                     Stone color)
              throws InvalidFieldException
        Sets the content of the intersection represented by the 2D coordinate to the stone s.
        Parameters:
        coordinate - the intersection's 2D coordinate
        color - of the stone to be placed
        Throws:
        InvalidFieldException - when trying to set invalid field (outside board)
        Requires
        2D coordinate be a valid intersection
        Ensures
        2D coordinate to be set to Stone s

      • checkSamePreviousState

        public boolean checkSamePreviousState​(Stone[][] newState)
        Check if the current board state is equal to any previous state. NOTE: do checking BEFORE adding the new state to the list, otherwise it will always be true

        color - of the stone to be placed
        Requires
        2D coordinate be a valid intersection
        Ensures
        2D coordinate to be set to Stone s

        public int above​(int index)
        Returns the index of the intersection above the given intersection, or -1 if outside board.
        Parameters:
        index - intersection to start from
        Requires
        index to refer to a valid intersection

        public int below​(int index)
        Returns the index of the intersection below the given intersection, or -1 if outside board.
        Parameters:
        index - intersection to start from
        Requires
        index to refer to a valid intersection

        Requires
